Synopsis: 
Shortly after starting the Spanish Civil War, the Republic sent 3,000 children to the Soviet Union to protect them from bombing Franco. First to leave were children without parents, children in orphanages. 

Our leading lady called Paula, the daughter of a wealthy family on the right, with father and brother Falangists who had the misfortune of becoming pregnant by a man who refused to marry her, how could an abortion, religious beliefs, nor assume motherhood outside of marriage, becomes a victim of its own ideology, and has to hide her child in an orphanage in Madrid. Upon learning of your child's impending trip to Russia, steals the identity of a dead Republican to volunteer as a caregiver for children, and so terrible a journey with his son surrounded by their natural enemies, thousands of miles their country and its people. 

On June 41, Hitler invaded the Soviet Union in September was ten miles from Moscow. Convoys of Spanish children fleeing the city to Stalingrad. The continuous arrival of fresh troops for the defense of Moscow and again hinder the journey of the Spanish, one of these stops are joined by a political commissar of the Communist Party of Spain is going to heal their wounds of war in Samarkand; This character will become our male protagonist, called Alvaro. 

Production notes: 
- Inspired by several facts. "Ispansi (Spanish!)" Is intended to be primarily a meeting between the two Spains, represented here by two enemies of the civil war: a woman's right-wing Republican and a political commissar, both with a shared ideal: to save one convoy of Spanish children in the Soviet Union, the Volga at Stalingrad during the Second World War.
